name: la Llorona
summary: A sprectral 'wailing woman' in Spanish she haunts river and ditch banks searching for the children she drowned in madness.
description: A sprectral 'wailing woman' in Spanish she haunts river and ditch banks searching for the children she drowned in madness after her husband spurned her.
location: found along rivers and ditches thoughout the Spanish speaking regions of the Americas.

name: Manticore
summary: the manticore has the face of a human, body of a red lion, a tail ending in either a scorpion's or ending in spikes that it could shoot like arrows
description: Persian for man-eater; the manticore has the face of a human, body of a red lion, a tail ending in either a scorpion's or ending in spikes that it could shoot like arrows.  it was believed to have the face of a human and bright blue eyes as well as three rows of teeth.

name: Nixies
summary: Shapeshifting water spirits of Germanic and Scandinavian lore
description: Shapeshifting water spirits of Germanic and Scandinavian lore. known to deceive and drown unsuspecting victims.
location: found in bodies of water throught the Germanic world

name: Jackalope
summary: The Jackalope has the appearance a jack-rabbit with the horns of a antelope.
description: The Jackalope has the appearance a jack-rabbit with the horns of a antelope.  most commonly seen in the western states of from Montana down to New Mexico.  The Jackalope has the ability to  mimic the voice of humansnand were known to use this against those pursuing them.  It is believed that they mated during lightning storms.
location: the western United States including Montana, Colorado, New Mexico
